slokas: अर्जुन उवाचप्रकृतिं पुरुषं चैव क्षेत्रं क्षेत्रज्ञमेव च ।एतद्वेदितुमिच्छामि ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं च केशव ॥ १ ॥
slokas_translated: “Arjuna asked: My Lord! Who is God and what is Nature; what is Matter and what is the Self; what is that they call Wisdom, and what is it that is worth knowing? I wish to have this explained.

slokas: श्रीभगवानुवाचइदं शरीरं कौन्तेय क्षेत्रमित्यभिधीयते ।एतद्यो वेत्ति तं प्राहु: क्षेत्रज्ञ इति तद्विद: ॥ २ ॥
slokas_translated: Lord Shri Krishna replied: O Arjuna! The body of man is the playground of the Self; and That which knows the activities of Matter, sages call the Self.

slokas: क्षेत्रज्ञं चापि मां विद्धि सर्वक्षेत्रेषु भारत ।क्षेत्रक्षेत्रज्ञयोर्ज्ञानं यत्तज्ज्ञानं मतं मम ॥ ३ ॥
slokas_translated: I am the Omniscient self that abides in the playground of Matter; knowledge of Matter and of the all-knowing Self is wisdom.

slokas: तत्क्षेत्रं यच्च‍ यादृक्‍च यद्विकारि यतश्च यत् ।स च यो यत्प्रभावश्च तत्समासेन मे श‍ृणु ॥ ४ ॥
slokas_translated: What is called Matter, of what it is composed, where it came, and why it changes, what the Self is, and what Its power – this I will now briefly set forth.

slokas: ऋषिभिर्बहुधा गीतं छन्दोभिर्विविधै: पृथक् ।ब्रह्मसूत्रपदैश्चैव हेतुमद्भ‍िर्विनिश्चितै: ॥ ५ ॥
slokas_translated: Seers have sung of It in various ways, in many hymns and sacred Vedic songs, weighty in thought and convincing in argument.

slokas: महाभूतान्यहङ्कारो बुद्धिरव्यक्तमेव च ।इन्द्रियाणि दशैकं च पञ्च चेन्द्रियगोचरा: ॥ ६ ॥
slokas_translated: The five great fundamentals (earth, fire, air, water and ether), personality, intellect, the mysterious life force, the ten organs of perception and action, the mind and the five domains of sensation;

slokas: इच्छा द्वेष: सुखं दु:खं सङ्घातश्चेतना धृति: ।एतत्क्षेत्रं समासेन सविकारमुदाहृतम् ॥ ७ ॥
slokas_translated: Desire, aversion, pleasure, pain, sympathy, vitality and the persistent clinging to life, these are in brief the constituents of changing Matter.

slokas: अमानित्वमदम्भित्वमहिंसा क्षान्तिरार्जवम् ।आचार्योपासनं शौचं स्थैर्यमात्मविनिग्रह: ॥ ८ ॥
slokas_translated: Humility, sincerity, harmlessness, forgiveness, rectitude, service of the Master, purity, steadfastness, self-control;

slokas: इन्द्रियार्थेषु वैराग्यमनहङ्कार एव च ।जन्ममृत्युजराव्याधिदु:खदोषानुदर्शनम् ॥ ९ ॥
slokas_translated: Renunciation of the delights of sense, absence of pride, right understanding of the painful problem of birth and death, of age and sickness;

slokas: असक्तिरनभिष्वङ्ग: पुत्रदारगृहादिषु ।नित्यं च समचित्तत्वमिष्टानिष्टोपपत्तिषु ॥ १० ॥
slokas_translated: Indifference, non-attachment to sex, progeny or home, equanimity in good fortune and in bad;

slokas: मयि चानन्ययोगेन भक्तिरव्यभिचारिणी ।विविक्तदेशसेवित्वमरतिर्जनसंसदि ॥ ११ ॥
slokas_translated: Unswerving devotion to Me, by concentration on Me and Me alone, a love for solitude, indifference to social life;

slokas: अध्यात्मज्ञाननित्यत्वं तत्त्वज्ञानार्थदर्शनम् ।एतज्ज्ञानमिति प्रोक्तमज्ञानं यदतोऽन्यथा ॥ १२ ॥
slokas_translated: Constant yearning for the knowledge of Self, and pondering over the lessons of the great Truth – this is Wisdom, all else ignorance.

slokas: ज्ञेयं यत्तत्प्रवक्ष्यामि यज्ज्ञात्वामृतमश्न‍ुते ।अनादिमत्परं ब्रह्म न सत्तन्नासदुच्यते ॥ १३ ॥
slokas_translated: I will speak to you now of that great Truth which man ought to know, since by its means he will win immortal bliss – that which is without beginning, the Eternal Spirit which dwells in Me, neither with form, nor yet without it.

slokas: सर्वत: पाणिपादं तत्सर्वतोऽक्षिशिरोमुखम् ।सर्वत:श्रुतिमल्ल‍ोके सर्वमावृत्य तिष्ठति ॥ १४ ॥
slokas_translated: Everywhere are Its hands and Its feet; everywhere It has eyes that see, heads that think and mouths that speak; everywhere It listens; It dwells in all the worlds; It envelops them all.

slokas: सर्वेन्द्रियगुणाभासं सर्वेन्द्रियविवर्जितम् ।असक्तं सर्वभृच्च‍ैव निर्गुणं गुणभोक्तृ च ॥ १५ ॥
slokas_translated: Beyond the senses, It yet shines through every sense perception. Bound to nothing, It yet sustains everything. Unaffected by the Qualities, It still enjoys them all.

slokas: बहिरन्तश्च भूतानामचरं चरमेव च ।सूक्ष्मत्वात्तदविज्ञेयं दूरस्थं चान्तिके च तत् ॥ १६ ॥
slokas_translated: It is within all beings, yet outside; motionless yet moving; too subtle to be perceived; far away yet always near.

slokas: अविभक्तं च भूतेषु विभक्तमिव च स्थितम् ।भूतभर्तृ च तज्ज्ञेयं ग्रसिष्णु प्रभविष्णु च ॥ १७ ॥
slokas_translated: In all beings undivided, yet living in division, It is the upholder of all, Creator and Destroyer alike;

slokas: ज्योतिषामपि तज्ज्योतिस्तमस: परमुच्यते ।ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं ज्ञानगम्यं हृदि सर्वस्य विष्ठितम् ॥ १८ ॥
slokas_translated: It is the Light of lights, beyond the reach of darkness; the Wisdom, the only thing that is worth knowing or that wisdom can teach; the Presence in the hearts of all.

slokas: इति क्षेत्रं तथा ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं चोक्तं समासत: ।मद्भ‍क्त एतद्विज्ञाय मद्भ‍ावायोपपद्यते ॥ १९ ॥
slokas_translated: Thus I have told you in brief what Matter is, and the Self worth realising and what is Wisdom. He who is devoted to Me knows; and assuredly he will enter into Me.

slokas: प्रकृतिं पुरुषं चैव विद्ध्यनादी उभावपि ।विकारांश्च गुणांश्चैव विद्धि प्रकृतिसम्भवान् ॥ २० ॥
slokas_translated: Know you further that Nature and God have no beginning; and that differences of character and quality have their origin in Nature only.

slokas: कार्यकारणकर्तृत्वे हेतु: प्रकृतिरुच्यते ।पुरुष: सुखदु:खानां भोक्तृत्वे हेतुरुच्यते ॥ २१ ॥
slokas_translated: Nature is the Law which generates cause and effect; God is the source of the enjoyment of all pleasure and pain.

slokas: पुरुष: प्रकृतिस्थो हि भुङ्क्ते प्रकृतिजान्गुणान् ।कारणं गुणसङ्गोऽस्य सदसद्योनिजन्मसु ॥ २२ ॥
slokas_translated: God dwelling in the heart of Nature experiences the Qualities which nature brings forth; and His affinity towards the Qualities is the reason for His living in a good or evil body.

slokas: उपद्रष्टानुमन्ता च भर्ता भोक्ता महेश्वर: ।परमात्मेति चाप्युक्तो देहेऽस्मिन्पुरुष: पर: ॥ २३ ॥
slokas_translated: Thus in the body of man dwells the Supreme God; He who sees and permits, upholds and enjoys, the Highest God and the Highest Self.

slokas: य एवं वेत्ति पुरुषं प्रकृतिं च गुणै: सह ।सर्वथा वर्तमानोऽपि न स भूयोऽभिजायते ॥ २४ ॥
slokas_translated: He who understands God and Nature along with her qualities, whatever be his condition in life, he comes not again to earth.

slokas: ध्यानेनात्मनि पश्यन्ति केचिदात्मानमात्मना ।अन्ये सांख्येन योगेन कर्मयोगेन चापरे ॥ २५ ॥
slokas_translated: Some realise the Supreme by meditating, by its aid, on the Self within, others by pure reason, others by right action.

slokas: अन्ये त्वेवमजानन्त: श्रुत्वान्येभ्य उपासते ।तेऽपि चातितरन्त्येव मृत्युं श्रुतिपरायणा: ॥ २६ ॥
slokas_translated: Others again, having no direct knowledge but only hearing from others, nevertheless worship, and they, too, if true to the teachings, cross the sea of death.

slokas: यावत्सञ्जायते किञ्चित्सत्त्वं स्थावरजङ्गमम् ।क्षेत्रक्षेत्रज्ञसंयोगात्तद्विद्धि भरतर्षभ ॥ २७ ॥
slokas_translated: Wherever life is seen in things movable or immovable, it is the joint product of Matter and Spirit.

slokas: समं सर्वेषु भूतेषु तिष्ठन्तं परमेश्वरम् ।विनश्यत्स्वविनश्यन्तं य: पश्यति स पश्यति ॥ २८ ॥
slokas_translated: He who can see the Supreme Lord in all beings, the Imperishable amidst the perishable, he it is who really sees.

slokas: समं पश्यन्हि सर्वत्र समवस्थितमीश्वरम् ।न हिनस्त्यात्मनात्मानं ततो याति परां गतिम् ॥ २९ ॥
slokas_translated: Beholding the Lord in all things equally, his actions do not mar his spiritual life but lead him to the height of Bliss.

slokas: प्रकृत्यैव च कर्माणि क्रियमाणानि सर्वश: ।य: पश्यति तथात्मानमकर्तारं स पश्यति ॥ ३० ॥
slokas_translated: He who understands that it is only the Law of Nature that brings action to fruition, and that the Self never acts, alone knows the Truth.

slokas: यदा भूतपृथग्भावमेकस्थमनुपश्यति ।तत एव च विस्तारं ब्रह्म सम्पद्यते तदा ॥ ३१ ॥
slokas_translated: He who sees the diverse forms of life all rooted in One, and growing forth from Him, he shall indeed find the Absolute.

slokas: अनादित्वान्निर्गुणत्वात्परमात्मायमव्यय: ।शरीरस्थोऽपि कौन्तेय न करोति न लिप्यते ॥ ३२ ॥
slokas_translated: The Supreme Spirit, O Prince, is without beginning, without Qualities and Imperishable, and though it be within the body, yet It does not act, nor is It affected by action.

slokas: यथा सर्वगतं सौक्ष्म्यादाकाशं नोपलिप्यते ।सर्वत्रावस्थितो देहे तथात्मा नोपलिप्यते ॥ ३३ ॥
slokas_translated: As space, though present everywhere, remains by reason of its subtlety unaffected, so the Self, though present in all forms, retains its purity unalloyed.

slokas: यथा प्रकाशयत्येक: कृत्स्‍नं लोकमिमं रवि: ।क्षेत्रं क्षेत्री तथा कृत्स्‍नं प्रकाशयति भारत ॥ ३४ ॥
slokas_translated: As the one Sun illuminates the whole earth, so the Lord illumines the whole universe.

slokas: क्षेत्रक्षेत्रज्ञयोरेवमन्तरं ज्ञानचक्षुषा ।भूतप्रकृतिमोक्षं च ये विदुर्यान्ति ते परम् ॥ ३५ ॥
slokas_translated: Those who with the eyes of wisdom thus see the difference between Matter and Spirit, and know how to liberate Life from the Law of Nature, they attain the Supreme.”
